entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the @{item longsword|phb}, @{item shortsword|phb}, @{item shortbow|phb}, and @{item longbow|phb}.

entries.name: Wellspring of Vitality
entries: You are proficient in saving throws against death. One per short rest, you may remove one death-save failure as a bonus action.
Living mostly in seclusion for centuries, the Sidhe have kept an insular community on their island home of Sidhe Praxen.

Their culture is characterized largely by xenophobia, and reactionary atavism, and they rarely interact with the rest of the known world except through the Petarans, with whom they maintain a trade monopoly.

While rarely seen on the Mainland, the occasional exile ekes out a living on the margins, spending much of their energy keeping their ancestry hidden for fear of reprisal from superstition or over-caution.

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the @{item longsword|phb}, @{item shortsword|phb}, @{item shortbow|phb}, and @{item longbow|phb}.

entries: You are proficient in saving throws against death. One per short rest, you may remove one death-save failure as a bonus action.
Living mostly in seclusion for centuries, the Sidhe have kept an insular community on their island home of Sidhe Praxen.

Their culture is characterized largely by xenophobia, and reactionary atavism, and they rarely interact with the rest of the known world except through the Petarans, with whom they maintain a trade monopoly.

While rarely seen on the Mainland, the occasional exile ekes out a living on the margins, spending much of their energy keeping their ancestry hidden for fear of reprisal from superstition or over-caution.

entries.name: Water Familiarity
entries: You have advantage on all checks made to swim and to hold your breath.

Halflings have been nomadic since the mists of memory, but have also been denied a homeland of their own since the age of the Ubrekti Empire. Under the Concord of the Highways, they enjoy free movement between the polities of the Mainland.

Boat Halflings are a feature of the waterways, using their position and knowledge to transport and trade over canal and river for over a thousand years. The relative immobility of their waterways means they are more sedentary than their Road Halfling cousins.
